alert.note: Alert for Northeastern Yellowstone; Northern Big Horn; Treasure (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 04 at 3:45PM MDT by NWS Billings
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of north central Big Horn, northeastern Yellowstone and south central Treasure Counties through 415 PM MDT... At 343 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 11 miles southeast of Custer, or 20 miles southwest of Hysham, moving north at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail with heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Bighorn. This advisory does not include the city of Billings. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Motorists on I-94 should prepare for rapidly changing conditions. Heavy rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Northeastern Yellowstone; Northern Big Horn; Treasure
